headline: Southern Potato Salad
description: This Southern potato salad is served warm and is a classic with mayonnaise, sweet pickle, garlic, mustard, bits of celery, and diced hard boiled eggs.

video.description: See how to make a Southern-style potato salad that you serve warm.
video.name: Southern Potato Salad

name: Southern Potato Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes; drain and chop.

At the same time, place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring water to a boil; cover, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from hot water; peel and chop.
Combine cooked potatoes and eggs with mayonnaise, celery, relish, garlic, mustard, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Gently mix together and serve warm.

review.reviewBody: It was really tasty

i always leave skins on. a good base from which to add various herbs at serving, if desired. i seldom want a whole recipe of dill salad, but adding a dash to a serving, or o thyme, or even curry, can be nice.
This is delicious. I added a little extra mustard and 1Tbs vinegar. I also used dill relish and 1tsp of sugar. I cut the potatoes up after they cooled and spread on a cookie sheet to firm up.

very good I added 1/2 tablespoon of apple cider vinegar to the wet mixture, added some chopped gherkins sweet pickles for more crunch, no garlic, 7 boiled eggs, used 1.5 lb bag of little potatoes and left skins on. note to self....boiled for 17 minutes with chopped pieces....need to take off sooner.

Very good. I needed a side dish with the barbecue my husband was fixing. I have never made potato salad before even thou my mom made it often when I was growing up. 

My husband said it was the best he ever had. I did add a splash of vinegar and everything bagel seasoning. Will definitely make again.

Potato Salad is kind of hard to make. You can make it once and its perfect and the next time your scratching your head as to what did I miss. This is pretty spot on except I had to increase it to 6 servings and not 4. The little button that was suppose to help with changing the servings doesnt seem to work so I had to use math and eyeball. Haha The only thing I will confess that I changed was the celery. I didnt want to buy a whole bunch for just a Half a stalk that was silly, so I used about 1/4 tsp of celery flakes. Maybe too much but not bad. Couldn't find the equivalent so it was a wild guess. If anyone has a suggestion please chime in.

Good base recipe to make as-is or to tweak to your liking. I poured a little apple cider vinegar over the potatoes after cooking/chopping but before adding the rest of the dressing and let it soak that in while cooling, and also added paprika, fresh dill, and cucumber to the dish. Turned out exactly as I expected and wanted it to.

Very easy but full of flavor! I agree with adding vinegar and a pinch of sugar to balance the acid. I also added Sicilian Oregano, smoked paprika, pinch of cayenne pepper, & pepperoncini. An elevated flavor with a slight kick in every bite!

I like the recipe. Simple and straight forward. The only thing is that was not spicy and flavorful enough for me; so, I added some Season All Seasoning, a little more relish, and sprinkled smoked paprika on top.
Thanks for sharing this wonderful recipe!
Not a fan...the garlic was my first clue, should have followed my instincts and omitted it.
We don't like celery, but followed the rest of the recipe and loved it! Next time I made it I used Greek yogurt as some other people suggested and STILL loved it!
Pretty much a perfect potato salad.

I've been looking for a recipe close to my Mom's potato salad since she passed away a little over a year ago and this was really close! I did add a little celery seed and next time I may add just a bit more sweet relish.

Great recipe! I tossed potatoes with a TBSP of vinegar and almost a TBSP of sugar like other reviewers suggested. I had white vinegar so that’s what I used. I chopped up Wickles original pickles for the sweet pickle relish and only used a couple tablespoons but more would’ve been better. It turned out great.

Used sweet pickles chopped in place of relish
Dijon crunchy mustard
Garlic stuffed olives chopped

I can finally come to the family bbq's with my own homemade potato salad. I basically used this recipe as a base. The instructions are a little vague if you have never made potato salad. My number one tip would be to boil your potatoes with the skin on and allow them to cool for a few hours. Cold potatoes are easier to work with. Also keep in mind that potatoes hold a lot of water and using hot potatoes will generate steam thus making your potato salad watery. I boiled the eggs in salt water for about 15 minutes and allowed them to cool as well. I also added chopped green onions and red bell peppers. About 1/2 cup of each. I mixed the mayo and mustard together first, so that if it was too strong or not strong enough I would not ruin the entire potato salad. I should just write my own recipe lol
DELISH TO THE END
Never ever make southern potato salad with sweet relish... Dill tart pickles are the secret. That's the problem with the American diet, too much sugar. Ugh!

Delicious potato salad and the perfect side dish for my gumbo. Entire family loved it and went back for seconds.
Thanks for sharing.
Made this again and just keep loving it. So easy and love the idea of not having to make it so far in advance to chill it. Just know I will be making it again and again.

I could not find relish here in Japan so I chopped up gherkins and mixed pickles to make my own. 

My wife took the leftovers to work the next and 3 people said it was the best Egg Salad they had ever had. 

Will be making it again this weekend as it is easy and delicious!

In the past it was always touch and go when making potato salad! Well, let me say this southern potato salad is all that and more! I followed it to the the letter and it was the best potato salad I ever made! No more touch and go for me, this recipe is a keeper!

It's Decent. I always use Yukon Gold potatoes in my Potato Salad, since they work much better than Idaho & Russets for me (texture). I always add in some finely diced red or green Bell Peppers, as well (to taste). We're not fans of mustard in our salads (except for Egg Salad) so I usually leave out mustard for us.

This potato salad is just great. It is not only Southern, my family came from Europe and we have enjoyed this recipe forever. It has been passed down through the generations. I'm 76 and it has already been passed down to the next generation. So ladies, try it just as written first, then if needed, made it your own. Enjoy.
Loved it but I added EVOO and made my eggs a little under cooked and runny to color the salad. I diced up celery extra fine
I learned from a recipe that after boiling the eggs separate the egg yolks from the whites and mash the egg yolks into the mayo dressing makes it even more creamy
I added a little bit of red wine vinegar
It was good. Next time I will try adding some chopped olives or capers.
YUM!
I liked it I recommend it.

I’m not usually a fan of potato salad. My husband loves it, so when I made this he thought it was Christmas again! Lol I actually thought it was good also! I used the tip of letting potatoes soak in vinegar and sugar mix. Again super delicious

Because my husband is allergic to anything pickled, I left out the relish. We love garlic so I added a couple of extra cloves and also added onion powder. It's delicious and can't wait to make it for more than just us.
Really great for those who don't like onions in their potato salad. I am also not a big fan of celery, but I just chopped it up into really small pieces, but you could easily skip it too.
My family loves it!
Perfect! Sometimes I add just a little bit more mayo. I have made several times and everyone likes it!
Followed recipe exactly and it was delicious!! There were no leftovers!
Definitely an easy and nice potato salad. Added some of my own Cajun flare to it by boiling potatoes and eggs in crab boil and adding way more garlic. Can never have enough garlic.
My husband loved this! Perfect creamy potato salad. I used Yukon Gold potatoes and omitted the celery because I didn’t have any.

Perview family said awesome! My daughter licked the bowl clean I mixed it all together in! Added a splash of apple cider vinegar to the sauce, and a handful of bacon bits. Chilled the potatos. Folded sauce into potato and garlic base. No more store bought potato salad again!
Followed the recipe and we liked it.
Delicious and easy to follow. I added less mayonnaise as a personal preference but definitely a go to recipe this summer!

Excellent potato salad! I did things differently. I peeled and chopped the potatoes before boiling them. They were ready in just over 10 min. I've made potato salad that's been flavorless, so while the potatoes were still warm, I sprinkled about a tblsp of Greek salad dressing over and let soak in. At this time, I also followed what a reviewer who knows about Southern cooking mentioned and that was adding apple cider vinegar and a little sugar. Adding the dressing and vinegar were probably what made this a little mushy, but I didn't care.....it was so delicious! I also did not miss the onions. While serving, I like to also top with some green olives or radishes. Thanks for this great recipe which I'll surely make again!
Pretty easy to make and the taste was really good.
Agree with other reviews, this is the mustard-based potato salad like Grandma used to make :)

Solid recipe. A little heavy on mustard for my taste, so I might go with 1 Tbs. next time. I took a reviewer's advice and sliced the potatoes in half for boiling, and they were perfect at 12 mins. I also took her advice to chill the potatoes so they keep their shape. This is my go-to potato salad recipe from now on.

Added some finely sliced red and green bell pepper/capsicum for colour/texture, and one small spring onion for bite. Used Dijon mustard as well.
Family was very impressed.
I will make this again; I can't think of anything that would make it better!

this was my first time making this recipe it was actually my first making potato salad and it turned out really good. i did not have any celery, and i didnt put the garlic in it but it was still really good
Made this over the weekend for a bbq and everyone raves about it. I will definitely make this potato salad again!
Great tasting and my husband loved it! I will make it again and again!!

Amazing recipe. Didn’t have celery but didn’t really miss it either. I often use honey mustard in my potato salad but followed this recipe and was delighted the relish added enough sweetness without being heavy or goopy. I used a mixture of the two potato’s I had on hand also turned out well! I’d say this is the perfect canvas recipe if you’re trying to get funky too with your potato salad. Yummy!
A nice recipe, I modified it by using sliced olives.

Versatile and easy with ingredients you always have on hand. I loved the addition of the garlic. I didn't have relish but had some bread and butter pickles that I chopped up. Also added a splash of dill pickle juice and it just amped it up. Will definitely make again. Good cold, too!
I didn't have sweet relish so I used dill and added a few tablespoons of Moreno sugar. Turned out pretty well.
left out the relish and used chopped stuffed olives instead and substituted Hidden Valley Ranch dressing for the mayo. Best potato salad i ever ate.

Perfect name for this recipe! This is exactly what I was looking for in a potato salad. I had everything on hand and we couldn't stop eating it. I made the eggs a few hours before I wanted to make the potato salad to save myself some time.
This is the only potato salad I have ever liked. Big hit at the cookout! I used red potatoes and it came out great
Yummy. My family loved it. And it was so easy to make.
I used Aoli and some capers. Also used 50/50 Greek yogurt to mayo.
I added capers and a little bit of habanero/mango hot sauce, it was amazing!

My husband said that this was the best potato salad I have ever made. Like someone mentioned, I mixed everything together before I folded it in to the potatoes. I used about 2.5 pounds of russet potatoes and followed the recipe and didn't change a thing. Delicious!
I omitted the garlic.
This is great , the idea of letting a little vinegar soak into the potatoes rocked !!!!! Just like my Aunt use to make !
Just like my Momma made when I was little... Always loved it. Quick and easy.
A new favorite for me!

Excellent, I live in the South and it is nice to refresh my memory.
We thoroughly enjoyed it and will have a repeat request soon as summer is just starting here. 

Thanks
Great recipe! Potato salad turned out delicious. I made it without eggs and halved the mustard. I also followed others' tips to add 1 TBS of sugar and 1 TBS of cider vinegar. Saved as a favorite!
I Love this recipe! Added red onions to mine though... ??
This is absolutely delicious, thank you!
Taste great, but taste great cold too.
Best recipe that everyone enjoy, added a little paprika. Perfect, thank you
I didn't make any changes and it was a very good potato salad.
Added 2-3 more potatoes and another egg, plus maybe 1.5 tsp of sugar. This will be my go-to recipe for potato salad. So yummy!
Really good and easy to do. Different from my usual mayo/mustard potato salad. I did add onion.
Followed it all the way. This one is a keeper!!
Perfect. Only change was I used bread and butter pickles chopped since I didn't have relish.
I didn't add the garlic clove. I did add 1/2 tsp onion powder, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp celery salt, 1 tsp of paprika, and 1 tsp of splenda.
great recipe!! i add a lttle chopped onion also...yum!!
This is a southern classic! I prefer it cold and my husband prefers it warm. I add an extra egg and more than twice the mustard to our taste preference
I like this potato salad, however, the potatoes needed longer then 15 min to boil. Mine came out hard in the center

I always bought my southern potato salad and then I found the recipe,Have made several batches and it keeps getting better.Only thing I changed was to boil my Potatoes a little longer. perfect Thanks.
This was wonderful potato salad!!!
Definitely add vinegar. Bacon bits add a yummy variation as well.
I always sprinkle paprika on top for color and I added celery salt too.

Thank you very much for sharing this recipe. I've tried making potato salad a few times and could never get it right ,until now...This one turned out GREAT !!! very delicious. I 'll definitely be making this again. Yum yum yum !! : ) : )
Very good flavour. Whole family loved.

Tried several potato salad recipes but this one was good. My husband loves potato salad but I could never make it until this recipe.I don't like celery so I just put some celery salt. Fried some bacon and crumbled in it which really gives it a southern flavor. I am going to try the vinegar next.
This turned out perfect!!! I didn't use garlic and I used dill relish instead of sweet relish. It turned out amazing!
Just like my southern grandmother always made. Lots of memories!

This was great! I added some apple cider vinegar, dill, and forgot the garlic. I used 6 small potatoes, which was just about 2 pounds. I think the recipe should specify that but it's okay. I boiled my potatoes for 15 minutes, drained them and left them in the colander with a clean rag over them to let them continue to cook while I made the dressing. I did not peel them because I like the added texture of the peel left on. I always like to dress my potato salad while it is still warm so the potatoes can absorb the dressing. I also added some extra salt and pepper since potatoes can usually handle a lot of seasoning. This turned out fantastic! Thanks for posting!
I really enjoyed this and I only made a couple of small changes. Left out the celery and added apple cider vinegar and a little sugar. Great recipe!!!
This was a perfect recipe. Not hard to make and the taste of it was on point.
Great recipe. I've made this so many times. The family loves it!
This is a wonderful potato salad recipe. My mom always made hers just like this while I was growing up. I now make it minus the celery and relish (picky kids.) Still turns out great!

This was a really good base for potato salad dressing. I made not quite a double batch using about a cup of mayo and half cup of relish. Also I used more celery (about 2 stalks), some very finely grated carrot (1 big one), and spicy brown mustard instead of just the regular ol' yellow stuff. I thought it was a little bit too sweet so I added about a teaspoon of ground New Mexico chili powder and 1 finely diced Thai chili. It turned out great. Tried it served warm as the recipe suggested but I liked it better after it was refrigerated for a few hours as the flavors had more time to blend.

I made this over the weekend for my daughters birthday party. I used the recipe as is except for adding a few chopped scallions (I love that pepper taste they add) and garnished it with a sprinkling of paprika and parsley. It was a big hit with a group of relatively picky eaters!

This recipe was good. We always add extra mayo to any potato salad. It was much better the next day after it sat overnight.We only used 2 eggs and used half the mustard and relish and doubled the mayo.I would make this again.
I love this recipe. The only changes that I made was leaving out the celery and garlic. Just as a personal preference.

In all my years (I'm a senior citizen) I have never even heard of serving warm potato salad. Maybe because all my life I've lived in Florida where we like our sides cold on a warm afternoon or evening. I enjoyed this potato salad and it tastes very similar to the 'old fashioned' recipe we enjoyed many years ago. Needless to say I prefer it cold. I added a little more mustard and a touch of vinegar which is a matter of personal taste. Thanks for the recipe.
